intro: Peucedanum vaseyi, commonly known as the Ethiopian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, temperate climates and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Peucedanum vaseyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
